{"step_by_step_thinking": "Syndromic craniosynostoses are a group of craniosynostoses that are associated with other congenital anomalies or syndromes. One of the most common genetic causes of syndromic craniosynostoses is mutations in the FGFR (fibroblast growth factor receptor) gene. Therefore, the majority of syndromic craniosynostoses are associated with FGFR mutations.", "answer_choice": "A"}
